sfpowerkit:auth:login.description: Login to an org using a username/password
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:auth:login -u azlam@sfdc.com -p Xasdax2w2  -a prod
      Authorized to azlam@sfdc.com

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

url.name: url
url.description: URL of the instance to be authenticated, Defaults to Test URL

sfpowerkit:org:destruct.description: This is a helper command to ease the deployment of destructiveChanges.xml. The command will create the empty package.xml and package the passed destructive manifest and deploy it to the org

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: The path to xml containing the members that need to be destructed,follow the instructions here to create such a file https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.daas.meta/daas/daas_destructive_changes.htm

sfpowerkit:org:healthcheck.description: Gets the health details of an org
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:healthcheck  -u myOrg@example.com
  Successfully Retrived the healthstatus of the org

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

sfpowerkit:org:orgcoverage.description: Gets the apex test coverage details of an org
examples:
$  sfdx sfpowerkit:org:orgcoverage  -u myOrg@example.com
  sfdx sfpowerkit:org:orgcoverage  -u myOrg@example.com -d testResult -f csv
  sfdx sfpowerkit:org:orgcoverage  -u myOrg@example.com -d testResult -f json


  Successfully Retrieved the Apex Test Coverage of the org XXXX
  coverage:85
  ID     		NAME                  TYPE          PERCENTAGE    COMMENTS                              UNCOVERED LINES
  ───────		──────────────────    ────────      ──────────	  ───────────────────────────────────   ──────────────────
  01pxxxx		sampleController      ApexClass     100%
  01pxxxx		sampletriggerHandler  ApexClass	    80%           Looks fine but target more than 85%   62;76;77;
  01pxxxx		sampleHelper          ApexClass	    72%           Action required                       62;76;77;78;98;130;131
  01qxxxx		sampleTrigger         ApexTrigger   100%
  Output testResult/output.csv is generated successfully

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

output.name: output
output.description: The output dir where the output will be created

format.name: format
format.description: The format for the test result output, Possible values are json/csv

sfpowerkit:package:valid.description: Validates a package to check whether it only contains valid metadata as per metadata coverage
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:package:valid -n testPackage
  Now analyzing testPackage
Converting package testPackage
Elements supported included in your package testPackage are
[
  "AuraDefinitionBundle",
  "CustomApplication",
  "ApexClass",
  "ContentAsset",
  "WorkflowRule"
]

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

bypass.name: bypass
bypass.description: metadatatypes to skip the package validation check

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: metadata API version to use for validation

sfpowerkit:project:diff.description: Generate a delta 'changeset' between two diff commits so that  the incremental changes can be deployed to the target org.To be used for an org based deployment and the size of the metadata is large that the project cannot not be deployed in a single attempt./nThis command works with a source format based repository only. Utilize the command during a transition phase where an org is transformed to a modular architecture composing of multiple projects.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

revisionfrom.name: revisionfrom
revisionfrom.description: Base revision from where diff is to be generated, required if diff file is ommited

revisionto.name: revisionto
revisionto.description: [default:HEAD] Target revision to generate the diff

output.name: output
output.description: The output dir where the incremental project will be created

generatedestructive.name: generatedestructive
generatedestructive.description: If set to true, the command will also generate a destructiveChangePost.xml file in the output folder.

bypass.name: bypass
bypass.description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Ignore comma seperated paths from the diff being generated, the  diff command doesnt generate a diff on the following paths

packagedirectories.name: packagedirectories
packagedirectories.description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Run diff only on specific paths, also generate a sfdx-project.json to support the corresponding package directory

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

sfpowerkit:project:orgdiff.description: Compare source file again the salesforce and display differences. Can optionally add diff conflict markers on file to let the developer accept or rejest changes manually using a git merge tool.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

filesorfolders.name: filesorfolders
filesorfolders.description: List of fils or folder to compare. Should be only Apex classes, trigger, Aura Components, Lightning Web Components or any unsplitted metadata.

noconflictmarkers.name: noconflictmarkers
noconflictmarkers.description: If set to true, the command will not add diff conflict marker to each compared file.

outputformat.name: outputformat
outputformat.description: [default: json]The format for the diff output, Possible values are json/csv.

sfpowerkit:source:pmd.description: This command is a wrapper around PMD ( downloads PMD for the first time) with some predefined defaults, such as ruleset, output format, output file. The command is to be run from the project directory

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

directory.name: directory
directory.description: [default: Default project directory as mentioned in sfdx-project.json] Override this to set a different directory in the project folder

ruleset.name: ruleset
ruleset.description: [default: sfpowerkit] The pmd ruleset that will be utilzied for analyzing the apex classes,  Checkout https://pmd.github.io/latest/pmd_userdocs_making_rulesets.html to create your own ruleset

format.name: format
format.description: [default: text] The format for the pmd output, Possible values are available at https://pmd.github.io/latest/pmd_userdocs_cli_reference.html#available-report-formats

report.name: report
report.description: [default: pmd-output] The path to where the output of the analysis should be written

javahome.name: javahome
javahome.description: The command will try to locate the javahome path to execute PMD automatically, set this flag to override it to another javahome path

supressoutput.name: supressoutput
supressoutput.description: [default: false] Supress the ouptut of the analysis to be displayed in the console

version.name: version
version.description: [default: 6.21.0] The version of the pmd to be utilized for the analysis, this version will be downloaded to sfpowerkit's cache directory

sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:create.description: Creates a connected app in the target org for JWT based authentication, Please note it only creates Connected App with All users may self authorize option, You would need to manually edit the policies to enable admin users are pre-approved and add your profile to this connected app
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:create -u myOrg@example.com -n AzurePipelines -c id_rsa -e azlam.salamm@invalid.com
  Created Connected App AzurePipelines in Target Org

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

name.name: name
name.description: Name of the connected app to be created

pathtocertificate.name: pathtocertificate
pathtocertificate.description: Filepath to the private certificate for the connected app to be created

email.name: email
email.description: Email of the connected app to be created

sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:retrieve.description: Retrieves the consumer key for a connected app, Useful after a sandbox refresh in a CD Environment
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:retrieve -n AzurePipelines -u azlam@sfdc.com 
  Retrived AzurePipelines Consumer Key : XSD21Sd23123w21321

sfpowerkit:org:manifest:build.description: Generate a complete manifest of all the metadata from the specified org. Once the manifest is generated use source:retrieve or mdapi:retrieve to retrieve the metadata.
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:manifest:build --targetusername myOrg@example.com -o package.xml
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <Package xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">...</Package>

$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:manifest:build --targetusername myOrg@example.com -o package.xml -q 'ApexClass, CustomObject, Report' 
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <Package xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata">...</Package>

sfpowerkit:org:profile:diff.description: Compare profiles from project against target org or between two orgs (source and target)
examples: $ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:profile:diff --profilelist profilenames --targetusername username (Compare liste profiles path against target org)
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:profile:diff --targetusername username (compare all profile in the project against the target org)
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:profile:diff --sourceusername sourcealias --targetusername username (compare all profile in the source org against the target org)

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

profilelist.name: profilelist
profilelist.description: List of profiles to compare, comma separated profile names. If not provided and no sourceusername is provided, all profiles from the source folder will be processed.

sourceusername.name: sourceusername
sourceusername.description: Source org. If no profile is provided in the profilelist parameter, all the profile from this org will be fetched

output.name: output
output.description: Output folder. Provide the output folder if comparing profiles from source org.

sfpowerkit:org:sandbox:create.description: Creates a sandbox using the tooling api, ensure the user has the required permissions before using this command

$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:sandbox:create -d Testsandbox -l DEVELOPER -n test2 -u myOrg@example.com

individualpackage.name: individualpackage
individualpackage.description: Installs a specific package especially for upgrade scenario

installationkeys.name: installationkeys
installationkeys.description: installation key for key-protected packages (format is 1:MyPackage1Key 2: 3:MyPackage3Key... to allow some packages without installation key)

wait.name: wait
wait.description: number of minutes to wait for installation status (also used for publishwait). Default is 10

noprompt.name: noprompt
noprompt.description: allow Remote Site Settings and Content Security Policy websites to send or receive data without confirmation

updateall.name: updateall
updateall.description: Update all packages even if they are installed in the target org

apexcompileonlypackage.name: apexcompileonlypackage
apexcompileonlypackage.description: Compile the apex only in the package, by default only the compilation of the apex in the entire org is triggered

sfpowerkit:package:version:codecoverage.description: This command is used to get the apex test coverage details of an unlocked package
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:package:version:codecoverage -v myOrg@example.com -i 04tXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX 
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:package:version:codecoverage -v myOrg@example.com -i 04tXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX,04tXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX,04tXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX 
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:package:version:codecoverage -v myOrg@example.com -p core -n 1.2.0.45 
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:package:version:codecoverage -v myOrg@example.com -p 0HoXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX -n 1.2.0.45

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: [default: info] logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: API version

package.name: package
package.description: Name of the unlocked package to check the code coverage, packageVersionNumber is required when packageName is used

versionnumber.name: versionnumber
versionnumber.description: The complete version number format is major.minor.patch (Beta build)—for example, 1.2.0 (Beta 5), packageName is required when packageVersionNumber is used

versionid.name: versionid
versionid.description: Package version Id to check the code coverage

loglevel.description: [default: info] logging level for this command invocation

sourcepath.name: sourcepath
sourcepath.description: Paths to the source package.xml file

targetpath.name: targetpath
targetpath.description: Paths to the target package.xml file

output.name: output
output.description: path to the diff output package.xml

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: The api version to be used create package.xml

format.name: format
format.description: [default: json] The format for the output, Possible values are json/csv/xml

sfpowerkit:project:manifest:merge.description: Merge multiple package.xml into single collective package.xml
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:project:manifest:merge -p project1/path/to/package.xml -d result/package.xml
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:project:manifest:merge -p project1/path/to/package.xml,project2/path/to/package.xml -d result/package.xml

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: [default: info] logging level for this command invocation

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: output path to create collective package.xml

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: The api version to be used create package.xml

sfpowerkit:source:apextestsuite:convert.description: Converts an apex test suite to its consituent apex classes as a single line separated by commas, so that it can be used for metadata api deployment

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the apextestsuite (the file name minus the apex test suite)

sfpowerkit:source:customlabel:buildmanif.description: This Command is used to build package.xml with all customlabels as members rather than wildcard *. sfdx force:source:convert creates a package.xml with customlabels wildcard, this command helps to update the package.xml with list of label names.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: [default: info] logging level for this command invocation

manifest.name: manifest
manifest.description: path to existing package.xml file or create new package.xml

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: The api version to be used create package.xml

sfpowerkit:source:customlabel:create.description: Custom Labels are org wide, hence when the metadata is pulled down from scratch org, the entire custom label metadata file is updated in a package repo. This command is a helper command to create customlabel with pacakage names prepended for easy reconcilation.
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:source:customlabel:create -u fancyScratchOrg1 -n FlashError -v "Memory leaks aren't for the faint hearted" -s "A flashing error --package core"
  Deployed CustomLabel FlashError in target org with core_  prefix, You may now pull and utilize the customlabel:reconcile command

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

fullname.name: fullname
fullname.description: Name of the custom label (API Name)

language.name: language
language.description: Language of the custom label (Default: en_US)

protected.name: protected
protected.description: Protected State of the custom label (Default: false)

shortdescription.name: shortdescription
shortdescription.description: Short Description of the custom label

package.name: package
package.description: The name of the package that needs to be appended

ignorepackage.name: ignorepackage
ignorepackage.description: Ignores the addition of the package into the fullname (API Name)

sfpowerkit:source:customlabel:reconcile.description: Custom Labels are org wide, hence when the metadata is pulled down from scratch org, the entire custom label metadata file is updated in a package repo, This command reconcile the updated custom labels to include only the labels that have the API name starting with package name or created using the custom label create command
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:source:customlabel:reconcile -d path/to/customlabelfile.xml -p core
    Cleaned The Custom Labels

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

project.name: project
project.description: The name of the package that needs to be reconciled

sfpowerkit:source:profile:merge.description: This command is used in the lower environments such as ScratchOrgs , Development / System Testing Sandboxes, inorder to apply the changes made in the environment to retrieved profile, so that it can be deployed to the higher environments
examples: $ sfdx sfpowerkit:source:profile:merge -f "module1, module2, module3" -n "My Profile1, My profile2"  -u sandbox

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

folder.name: folder
folder.description: comma separated list of folders to scan for profiles. If ommited, the folders in the packageDirectories configuration will be used.

profilelist.name: profilelist
profilelist.description: comma separated list of profiles. If ommited, all the profiles found in the folder(s) will be merged

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: comma separated list of metadata for which the permissions will be retrieved.

delete.name: delete
delete.description: set this flag to delete profile files that does not exist in the org.

sfpowerkit:source:profile:reconcile.description: This command is used in the lower environments such as ScratchOrgs , Development / System Testing Sandboxes, where a retrieved profile from production has to be cleaned up only for the metadata that is contained in the environment or  base it only as per the metadata that is contained in the packaging directory.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

folder.name: folder
folder.description: path to the folder which contains the profiles to be reconciled,if project contain multiple package directories, please provide a comma seperated list, if omitted, all the package directories will be checked for profiles

profilelist.name: profilelist
profilelist.description: list of profiles to be reconciled. If ommited, all the profiles components will be reconciled.

destfolder.name: destfolder
destfolder.description: the destination folder for reconciled profiles, if omitted existing profiles will be reconciled and will be rewritten in the current location

sourceonly.name: sourceonly
sourceonly.description: set this flag to reconcile profiles only against component available in the project only. Configure ignored perissions in sfdx-project.json file in the array plugins->sfpowerkit->ignoredPermissions.

targetorg.name: targetorg
targetorg.description: org against which profiles will be reconciled. this parameter can be ommited if sourceonly flag is set.

sfpowerkit:source:profile:retrieve.description: Retrieve profiles from the salesforce org with all its associated permissions. Common use case for this command is  to migrate profile changes from a integration environment to other higher environments [overcomes SFDX CLI Profile retrieve issue where it doesnt fetch the full profile unless the entire metadata is present in source], or retrieving profiles from production to lower environments for testing.
examples: $ sfdx sfpowerkit:source:profile:retrieve  -f "module1, module2, module3" -n "My Profile1, My profile2"  -u prod

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

folder.name: folder
folder.description: retrieve only updated versions of profiles found in this directory, If ignored, all profiles will be retrieved.

profilelist.name: profilelist
profilelist.description: comma separated list of profiles to be retrieved. Use it for selectively retrieving an existing profile or retrieving a new profile

delete.name: delete
delete.description: set this flag to delete profile files that does not exist in the org, when retrieving in bulk
